intro: Corydalis glaucescens subsp. pamiralaica, commonly known as the Pamir Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude habitats.
